This restaurant was highly recommended to us and gets excellent reviews so we were excited to get a reservation.  Let me begin with the positive aspects.  The restaurant is open past midnight on weekdays, which was great for us since we were waiting for friends to fly into Barcelona that evening.  It is a very lively place that appears to have remained popular for years (it was packed when we arrived at 11pm on a Thursday).  We really enjoyed the pan con tomate and the zucchini flowers... Unfortunately, this is where the good ends.  It was a disappointing evening to say the least. We expected the expensive menu but the portions were way too small.  The food was tasty so we had no problem just ordering more.  The problem was that our waiter was either too busy to serve us or could care less that we were there.  We did not expect him to understand much English but he was not patient at all as we tried to place our order.  It just felt as though he had more important things to do.  We were lucky to have a fluent Spanish speaker at the table but even she could barely finish her sentence before he ran away.  It was almost impossible to get drink refills or order more food.  Even when we did order another bottle of wine, it did not come until the end of our meal.  Of course, at this point, it looked like they were trying to close the restaurant so we almost felt uncomfortable hanging around to finish the wine.I like to give places the benefit of the doubt but after spending so much money, you at least expect to feel satisfied after a meal.  We just stopped ordering because it was so difficult to get any service.  This may have been the only evening of our trip when I felt as though I needed another meal.
